name: Agchoniôn
influence: Noise, music, hearing, meaningless sound.
places: Sonar stations, opera and concert houses, wind tunnels or narrow canyons, echo chambers.
materials: Bat’s ears, dolphin blood, recording tape, seashells, theremin music, parrot feathers, glass shattered by sound, bright yellow-green.

name: Akhouiy
influence: Indolence, drift, ease, luck, dumb luck, going with the flow.
places: Casinos, resort hotels, some taverns, much of Faërie, fountains (with coins), wishing wells.
materials: Four-leaf clovers, rabbits’ feet, upright horseshoes, beer, dice, stones with water-eroded holes through them, the small bone of a sheep’s head, honey, deep orange.

name: Akton
influence: Corruption, debauchery, sin, both the joys and ravages.
places: Alcoholic wards, whorehouses, crack dens, certain temples in North Africa, slave markets, the edge of the Abyss.
materials: Vomit, maggots, vitriol, cocaine, wormwood, venereal pus, pale yellow.

name: Alath
influence: Satiety, comfort, rest, boredom, stagnation, dampening.
places: Old-age homes, cold deserts, still tarns, ghost towns, a select London gentlemen’s club.
materials: Tortoiseshell, square and cuboid shapes, arsenic, ether, morphia or heroin, deep wine-purple.

name: Alleborith
influence: Magic at its purest, isolated, active magic, magical transmission.
places: Magical laboratories, pentacles, places of power, ley intersections, mana upwellings, Atlantis.
materials: Mandrake root, orichalcum, azoth, pyramid shapes, black cat whiskers, water from Atlantis, green moonstones, pineal glands, bright azure.

name: Anatreth
influence: Movement, evolution, progress, and speed (fast or slow), mainly physical.
places: Tornadoes, airports, speedways or freeways, lightning strikes, bullet-trains and their tracks.
materials: Arrows, bullets, fulgurites, cobra venom, hawk or osprey feathers, methamphetamine, henbane, violet.

name: Anostêr
influence: That which cannot be done, cannot be known, the impossible, the unnameable, the reverse face of knowledge and skill, the void that preceded creation.
places: Some peculiar rings of stone in New England, an isolated atoll in the Pacific, a mirage city in the Arabian desert, a hot spring beneath Antarctica.
materials: The noise of a cat’s passage, books never written, blood from a stone, imperceptible colors.

name: Arôtosael
influence: The cycle of making and destroying in all its facets.
places: Decisive battlefields, particle accelerators, chemical or alchemical laboratories, blacksmith shops, beehives, new forests, the Sargasso Sea.
materials: Ram’s horn (and anything else in a Fibonacci spiral), flint, clay, radioactives, E above high C, hammers, sage, murex dye or anything else reddish-purple

name: Atrax
influence: Nourishment, inner strength through sustenance, health and decay in the long term.
places: Supermarkets, bazaars, farmland, compost heaps, restaurants, gas stations, granaries, some fields in Sicily and Egypt.
materials: Bread, salt, woman’s hair, storax, saliva, fertilizer, peridots, light yellowish-tan.

name: Axiôphêth
influence: Gravity, weight, mass, forces holding things in place, oppression for its own sake.
places: Underneath tons of rock, sun-baked desert flats, labor camps, prisons, sweatshops, particularly oppressive cubicle farms, slave galleys, certain mountains in the Pamirs.
materials: Lead chains, iron weights, ballast from a ship that has traveled around the world, depleted uranium, indigo.

name: Barsafael
influence: Hidden truth, subconscious mind, primal unconfessed emotions and unknown strengths
places: Deep beneath the ocean or in hidden caves, cities unknown to mankind, dinosaur burial grounds, fragmentary worlds long forgotten, very old mountaintops in the Appalachians, limestone sinkholes in upper Quebec.
materials: Ambergris, petroleum, white noise, artesian water, taproots of plants, “U” shapes, crimson.

name: Belbel
influence: Pain, torment, sharpness, shadow, shock, loss, vengeful dead.
places: Torture chambers, death camps, deep in the rain- forests where sunlight never falls, widows’ walks, the shadow-burns in Hiroshima and Nagasaki, the edges of the Abyss.
materials: Funeral crepe, surgical steel, rust, ammonia, neurotoxins, dried blood, nettles, purple so dark that it appears black.

name: Bianakith
influence: The human body and mind, the template of humanity.
places: Crowded cities, human-scale statuary, portrait galleries, gymnasia.
materials: Lungwort, liverwort, elm, river clay, human blood or skin, starfish, GI Joe or Barbie doll or any other idealized poppet, ivory.

name: Buldumêch
influence: Wealth, treasure, gold, finance, greed.
places: Banks, stock market floors, gold mines, customs houses, money changers, jewelers, treasure troves.
materials: Money, anything expensive and hoarded, jackdaw or magpie feathers, cowrie shells, sapphires, toad venom, gold.

name: Charchnoumis
influence: Animals, bestial thoughts and instincts, shape-shifting
places: Zoos, slaughterhouses, nature preserves, forests, fresh animal tracks or kills, watering holes, Mount Ararat.
materials: Fresh animals’ blood or skin, bloodstones, fresh game spoor, hunters’ weapons, civet musk, hunting-horn music, anything dark blood-red.

name: Eneuth
influence: Fire and it's metaphorical equivalents: inspiration, lust, war, demagoguery.
places: Bonfires, firestorms, tropical or subtropical deserts at midday, war-torn lands to the south, lava flows, magmatic caverns, the Plane of Fire.
materials: Obsidian, asbestos, sulfur, fire opals, sodium, magnesium, rocket fuel, ash-wood wands, cones, olibanum, garlic, mustard, cayenne pepper, orange-yellow.

name: Harpax
influence: Plants, all things green and growing, both harmful and healing.
places: Sacred groves, rainforests, algal pools, weed-ridden croplands, hedge mazes.
materials: Green jade, holly, cedar, woodwind music, amanita mushrooms, ivy, coral, forest green.

name: Hephesimereth
influence: Nothingness, defeat, emptiness, loss.
places: Open abandoned pits, former cemeteries with the bodies disinterred, frozen Antarctic desert, the intergalactic vacuum, places where the ground has been sown with salt.
materials: Dead batteries, dust from an abandoned house, ashes, mistletoe, no color.

name: Ieropaêl
influence: Earth, soil, rock, the very concept of physicality.
places: Mountain caves, volcanoes, upthrust crags, grav- el beds and quarries, city parks, fertile land in the north, the Plane of Earth.
materials: Quartz, talc, slate, oak, lichen, worms, narcissus, orbs, dark brown.

name: Isrö
influence: Air, a breeze or a storm,  and it's metaphorical equivalents: the lightning strike of genius, airy chatter.
places: Windstorms, steppes, inside or atop clouds, on balloons or airships, cities atop plateaus in the east, the Plane of Air.
materials: Eagle feathers, chalcedony, galbanum, white orchids, helium, bird-bone knives, aspen, pink-white.

name: Iudal
influence: Boundaries, roads, portals, rivers, bridges, and other liminal and transitional thoughts and things. Time, distance and measurement.
places: Bridges, crossroads, doorways (especially post- and-lintel ones), boundary markers, rivers, interdimensional gates, outdoors during an eclipse, grandfather clocks.
materials: Keys, two-headed coins, juniper, alexandrites, tobacco, hollow bones, chalk, mirrors, rose-madder, cesium, cornmeal, amber.

name: Kumeatêl
influence: The ace up the sleeve, secrets, murmurs, aspects of codes, glyphs and runes.
places: Secret laboratories or military bases, hidden rooms or passages, labyrinths, lost cities, conspiratorial fast- nesses, pocket dimensions, certain university libraries.
materials: Artifacts with secrets, the number 13, walnuts, handcuffs, Christmas wrapping ribbon, silk cord, knots with hidden ends, rose (both the flower and the color).

name: Kurtaêl
influence: Death, fear, decay and disease, the undead.
places: Graveyards, terminal wards of hospitals, ruined buildings where people have died, plague pits, tombs, marshes, necromantic altars in Haiti, Transylvania, and elsewhere.
materials: Rowan, cypress, myrrh, contaminated syringes, rats, yew, hellebore, onyx, ebony, jet, pitch, any- thing black.

name: Marderô
influence: Rebellion, anger against injustice, violence from fear of chaos and disorder. Mutations, changes born of crisis, opportune disaster.
places: Revolutionary battlefields or massacres, police stations, some government buildings, meteor craters, disaster sites.
materials: Hammers, sickles, human blood, pepper, tear gas, axes, five-pointed stars (but not pentagrams), gunpowder, rhino hide, white-flecked azure.

name: Methiax
influence: True creation, form, shapes reality and dreams, some shape-shifting
places: Artist’s studios, movie theaters and movie sets, counterfeiter’s dens, certain very old vineyards in Greece and Turkey, hallucinations and hallucinogenic spaces, induced dream states, Faërie, copy centers and scriptoria.
materials: Pyrites, zircons, flashbulbs, eggs, pomegranate seeds, fractals, holograms, hallucinogens, fog, or any- thing gray.

name: Naôth
influence: Communication, language, imagery, symbolism, and teaching
places: Radio stations, printers, shared telepathic experiences, shared or archetypal dream states, universities, a few select bars, certain bookshops in London and Paris.
materials: Vervain, bay leaves, “V” shapes, stringed instruments or their strings, blue-gray.

name: Nefthada
influence: Pleasure and delight, thrills both physical and mental, the perfect moment.
places: Almost nowhere, save for perfect moments in time or space; some English and Japanese gardens achieve correspondence with Nefthada on a continuing basis, as do a very few building interiors.
materials: Champagne, star sapphires, silk or satin fab- rics, morning dew, pure oxygen, bright green.

name: Ouare
influence: Constructs, machines, alloys, and vehicles. Some golems and revenants.
places: Garages, metallurgical laboratories, inside moving vehicles, virtual-reality matrices, the Autobahn
materials: Gears and clockwork, plastic, microchips, brass, aluminum, olive-green, any artificial dye such as aniline.

name: Phoubêl
influence: Light and darkness, one requiring the other. Vision, blindness, and irreconcilable conflict.
places: Tropical beaches, outdoors at sunrise or sunset, tanning salons, cathedrals, stone circles, fireworks shows
materials: Heliotropes and other tropical flowers, flash- lights, cinnamon, “X” or cross shapes, laurel and hazelwood, black-and-white (or black-and-red) checkerboard patterns.

name: Phthenoth
influence: Cleansing, restoration, and healing both physical and metaphorical, of body and spirit.
places: Hospitals, the island of Cos, spring meadows after a rain, arches, Avalon.
materials: Balm, pure water, apples, watered wine, chicken soup, potash, Greek (“+”) crosses, lavender

name: Roêlêd
influence: Strong walls, thorns, antibiotics, defense, guardianship, alertness, preparation, wisdom of experience, danger-sense
places: Anywhere under surveillance or an electric-eye grid, castles and fortresses, missile silos and radar stations, firebreaks, guardhouses.
materials: Owl or raven feathers, oxhide, “M” shapes, dragon’s blood, unicorn horn, sirens and alarms, dog barks, tiger lilies, Kevlar, chain links, bronze (both the metal and the color).

name: Ruax
influence: Will, perception, sanity, drunkenness, hotter emotions, sleep, the phenomena of dreams.
places: Television studios or showrooms, hypnosis clinics or performances, drug parlors and opium dens, asylums, personal dreamscapes, memory palaces, certain lamaseries in Central Asia.
materials: Cathode-ray tubes, spirals, poppies, down- ward-pointing arrows, cerulean blue.

name: Sahu
influence: Concepts and activities such as archery, hunting and herding, and the wilds they take place in.
places: Mountainsides, the walls of Mycenae and Machu Picchu, the Kenyan high veldt, imposing statues or stone structures such as Mount Rushmore or the Sphinx and Pyramids of Giza.
materials: Basalt, sequoia wood, subsonics, arrowheads, sinew, fresh animal blood, opals, anything red and black.

name: Saphathoraél
influence: Water, liquids and their conceptual counterparts. That which flows easily or is hard to pin down.
places: Oceans, lakes, ships, reservoirs, wells and oases, ice rinks, sewers, islands to the west, the Plane of Water, the Pearl-Bright Ocean.
materials: Fish, the blood of drowned men, aquamarines and beryls, pearls, teardrop shapes, chalices, lotuses, ferns, kelp, Irish whiskey, the color blue.

name: Sphandôr
influence: The sensorium, intellect, passive knowledge, intuition, divination.
places: Computer rooms, hexagonal spaces, paintings or images of eyes, theatrical stages (especially the Globe), libraries (especially Alexandria).
materials: Agates and cat’s eyes, musk, hexagons, fennel, ringing bells, russet-red.

name: Tepsisem
influence: Beauty and its loss, transience and impermanence, steady diminution.
places: Museums, art auction houses, badly maintained (but once attractive) buildings, eroding statues.
materials: Works of art, rouge, acid rain, faded photographs, broken mirrors, velvet, sandalwood, cut hibiscus or lilies, scarlet.
